text.div:
Id: ANCDT38
Url: http://fhir.org/guides/who/anc-cds/PlanDefinition/ANCDT38
Version: 0.3.0
Identifier:

value: ANC.DT.38

Name: ANCDT38
Title: ANC.DT.38 Deworming and malaria prophylaxis
Status: active
Experimental: false
Type:

system: http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/plan-definition-type

code: eca-rule

Date: 2021-06-11T23:49:11-06:00
Publisher: World Health Organization (WHO)
Description: IF the woman is currently in a malaria-endemic setting, or in an area where there is greater than 20% prevalence of infection with any soil-transmitted helminths, THEN she should receive preventative treatment accordingly
Use Context:
codevaluedisplay
task ANC.B10. Counselling, in-facility management & treatment
Jurisdiction: 001
Libraries:
http://fhir.org/guides/who/anc-cds/Library/ANCDT38
Actions:
ANC.DT.38 Deworming and malaria prophylaxis:
When: named-event: ANC.B10. Counselling, in-facility management and treatment
Then:
Sleeping under an insecticide-treated bednet and the importance of seeking care and getting treatment as soon as she has any symptoms
If: applicability: Malaria-endemic setting = TRUE (Should Provide malaria prophylaxis)
IF the woman is currently taking co-trimoxazole, even in a malaria-endemic setting, she should not receive any dose of IPTp-SP. Women who are taking co-trimoxazole SHOULD NOT receive IPTp-SP. Taking both co-trimoxazole and IPTp-SP together can enhance side-effects, especially haematological side-effects such as anaemia.
If: applicability: (Malaria-endemic setting = TRUE) AND (Current medications" = "Co-trimoxazole") (Should Do not give IPTp-SP, because woman is taking co-trimoxazole)
In areas with a population prevalence of infection with any soil-transmitted helminths of 20% or higher OR a population anaemia prevalence 40% or higher, preventive anthelminthic treatment is recommended for pregnant women after the first trimester as part of worm infection reduction programmes
If: applicability: ("Population prevalence of soil-transmitted helminth infection" ≥ 20% ) OR ("Population prevalence of anaemia" ≥ 40%) (Should Conduct deworming)

name: ANCDT38
title: ANC.DT.38 Deworming and malaria prophylaxis
description: IF the woman is currently in a malaria-endemic setting, or in an area where there is greater than 20% prevalence of infection with any soil-transmitted helminths, THEN she should receive preventative treatment accordingly

trigger.name: ANC.B10. Counselling, in-facility management and treatment

action.title: Provide malaria prophylaxis
action.textEquivalent: Sleeping under an insecticide-treated bednet and the importance of seeking care and getting treatment as soon as she has any symptoms

documentation.label: WHO ANC recommendations (2016): C.6. Malaria prevention: intermittent preventive treatment in pregnancy (IPTp) (3)

action.title: Do not give IPTp-SP, because woman is taking co-trimoxazole
action.description: Do not give IPTp-SP, because woman is taking co-trimoxazole
action.textEquivalent: IF the woman is currently taking co-trimoxazole, even in a malaria-endemic setting, she should not receive any dose of IPTp-SP. Women who are taking co-trimoxazole SHOULD NOT receive IPTp-SP. Taking both co-trimoxazole and IPTp-SP together can enhance side-effects, especially haematological side-effects such as anaemia.

documentation.label: WHO ANC recommendations (2016): C.6. Malaria prevention: intermittent preventive treatment in pregnancy (IPTp) (3)

expression.expression: Should Do not give IPTp-SP, because woman is taking co-trimoxazole

action.title: Conduct deworming
action.textEquivalent: In areas with a population prevalence of infection with any soil-transmitted helminths of 20% or higher OR a population anaemia prevalence 40% or higher, preventive anthelminthic treatment is recommended for pregnant women after the first trimester as part of worm infection reduction programmes

documentation.label: WHO ANC recommendations (2016): C.4. Preventive anthelminthic treatment (3)

expression.description:
("Population prevalence of soil-transmitted helminth infection" ≥ 20% )
  OR ("Population prevalence of anaemia" ≥ 40%)
